attributes.action: Create a statutory body to secure and maintain Police DNA records
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
To setup an independent body to securely store and maintain all DNA records currently taken by the police during investigations.
It is important that we do not lose this valuable information but equally important that it should not be used for purposes which we are currently unaware.
The Police should be able to query the new DNA registrar and ask if a sample can be matched or not. 
The DNA database should only contain the DNA record and a person’s name or other unique identifier.
If a match is possible the Police should be provided with the unique identifier.
The new body will be totally responsible for the security and maintenance of these records.

This system will avoid records being held across the country with different Police Forces and remove the worry that people may have about security and the Police holding such information.
The system should explicitly not be used for medical or health screening services or any other service unconnected with maintaining law and order in the United Kingdom.
